title: Switch UI to Feedback Mode CTA, external Google Form, and remove pricing copy

requirements.summary: Remove any early-access/email-capture UI and replace with a single “Give Feedback” CTA wherever applicable, without changing other features.
acceptanceCriteria: No UI in the app asks users to join early access or capture an email address.
Any prior early-access CTA copy is replaced with a single CTA labeled exactly “Give Feedback”.
No functional changes are introduced beyond UI copy/link adjustments.

file_operations.description: Ensure the navigation uses a single CTA labeled exactly “Give Feedback” (no alternate early-access/email-capture copy) and remove any early-access style actions from the nav area. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Audit landing-page hero/CTA copy and actions to confirm there is no “Join Early Access” or email capture; if any such CTA exists, replace it with a single CTA labeled exactly “Give Feedback” that points to the same external feedback flow used elsewhere. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Remove or repurpose early-access/waitlist configuration usage so the app no longer exposes “early access”/waitlist semantics in UI wiring; ensure any remaining reference is aligned to the single “Give Feedback” CTA flow. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Change the primary “Give Feedback” navigation CTA to open the provided Google Form in a new tab and stop invoking the in-app feedback dialog.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Give Feedback” opens https://forms.gle/gQA8LJEqMBNJsooL6 in a new tab (uses target="_blank" with rel="noopener noreferrer" or equivalent).
The in-app modal dialog currently used for feedback collection is no longer shown from the navigation CTA.

file_operations.description: Replace the current modal-trigger behavior with a link/open action that opens https://forms.gle/gQA8LJEqMBNJsooL6 in a new browser tab using safe new-tab attributes (e.g., rel="noopener noreferrer"). Remove the GiveFeedbackDialog trigger/wiring from the navigation CTA. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Remove the in-app feedback dialog component since navigation no longer uses an in-app feedback dialog and feedback collection is handled by the external Google Form.

requirements.summary: Show an in-app thank-you message with the exact required text after the user initiates the feedback submission flow.
acceptanceCriteria: A thank-you message is displayed to the user with the exact text: “Thanks — your feedback helps shape what we build next.”
The message is shown in-app (e.g., toast/banner/inline message) without requiring backend changes.

file_operations.description: When the user clicks the “Give Feedback” CTA (initiating the external form flow), display an in-app toast/banner message with the exact text: “Thanks — your feedback helps shape what we build next.” Ensure this occurs without backend changes. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Remove the “Pro (£19/month) coming soon” footer line and eliminate any pricing mentions from the header/footer while keeping other content intact.
acceptanceCriteria: The footer no longer displays the text “Pro (£19/month) coming soon.”
No pricing text (currency symbols, amounts, or price-related copy) appears in the app header or footer.
All other footer/header content remains intact aside from the removed pricing mentions.

file_operations.description: Remove the footer sentence fragment containing “Pro (£19/month) coming soon” and adjust the remaining disclaimer copy so no pricing-related text remains, keeping all other footer elements and layout unchanged. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Audit header/navigation-rendered text to ensure there are no pricing mentions in the header area (and remove any if present) while preserving all non-pricing header content. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Audit the landing-page header and footer usage to ensure no pricing mentions appear in those regions; keep all other content intact aside from removing any pricing text if found. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
